meanings.definition: A feeling of anxiety or worry.
meanings.sent1: The sudden disquiet in her heart made her feel uneasy.
meanings.sent2: His constant disquiet about the upcoming exam was evident in his restless behavior.
meanings.sent3: The disquiet in the room before the big announcement was almost palpable.
meanings.sent4: The disquiet in her mind was like a storm brewing on the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The disquiet in his voice revealed his inner turmoil.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel anxious or worried.
meanings.sent1: She tried not to disquiet her friend with her own fears.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected news seemed to disquiet him greatly.
meanings.sent3: His attempts to disquiet his little sister always ended in giggles.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to disquiet the usually calm sea.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence of the night disquieted her more than any noise.

meanings.definition: To disturb the peace or tranquility of.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise from the construction site disquieted the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The howling wind disquieted the peaceful evening.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat loved to disquiet the sleeping dog.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected visitor disquieted the solitude of the old man's cabin.
meanings.sent5: The sudden clap of thunder disquieted the birds in the trees.
